column4: Hello could someone answer a newb question please?  Im trying to move files and folders around with the GUI (typing out commands is driving me insane.) But I don't seam to get a password so I can edit root folders/files which makes it impossible to do it thru the Gui.  What can I do?
FAQ. You use `sudo' with your _own_ passwd.
sec, lemme scroll up
are you running the command in a terminal?
it's normally a shell "builtin"
are you using a Csh-based shell?
err, you didn't have (weren't supposed) to install it; that was a question referencing which shell you are using when you get the ulimit error
`getent passwd $USER' should tell you the shell your user is configured to use by default
did you execute csh or tcsh at any time?
(and why are you attempting to execute your mud application as root?)
is that a mud daemon or a mud client?
daemon->server here
what mud daemon are you attempting to configure and execute?
I'm not familiar with it. Does their configuration/executing scheme require csh or tcsh? If so, you should direct your questions to them...
did you sort out your mud daemon issues?
No last night I went to bed to frustrated with it.  Was gona kill my computer. >_>
You know where I could go to get csh help like you said I should?  Can't seam to find much on it.
contact the developers of the mud daemon themselves, since it seems to be a local application-specific issue
Well it seams im a little screwed with the whole contacting the developer.  They kinda just posted this code on source forge and didn't leave a real E-mail.
surely within the tarball itself there exists a file with contact information?
Might of found something
